data.title: Hipster Hangout
data.text: I really like the vibe of the place (it's hipster-y and trendy), but the coffee is just not that great. As a place to study, it's fine, but if you want really good coffee, go to Saturn or Revelator, not here. That said, the staff is always really friendly, and they'll even let you hang out a bit after closing (which is good, since they close incredibly early), but for a coffee shop, the coffee is the least impressive part of the place, which isn't awesome.

data.title: Glutton Free Chili
data.text: Enjoyed a nice causal lunch.  As usual it was not terribly busy.  finding a parking place was the hardest part.  Chili was nice and warm.  It was quite tasty.  My work companions enjoyed a couple of sandwiches.  It is nice to eat in a quaint place.

data.title: Excellent breakfast and lunch in a very cool building
data.text: This is one of my favorite coffee shops in Birmingham. It is right around the corner from my office so I go often for breakfast and lunch. Great grit bowls in the morning and super sandwiches, soups and salads. A lot of choices for vegetarians and healthy eating, but the carnivores can have some chicken added to just about any menu item. Fantastic cupcakes, too!

data.title: Hip and friendly -- oh and a great Latte!
data.text: In town for a business meeting, I stopped here to kill a bit of time. The place was fairly busy -- people meeting, doing work on laptops. Decor is relaxed.  Had an oatmeal muffin and a great soy latte. Nice way to start the day!

data.title: FAVORITE in all of bham!!
data.text:
I'm a college student in Bham, and this is hands down my favorite meal. Everything on the menu is straight magic, but my favorites are the Veggie Burger and the Chicken Panino--if a sandwich could change your life, it would be one of those. I'm not vegetarian or vegan (and neither is this whole restaurant!), but I eat everything here and it's amazing. 
The coffee options are geared more towards coffee-lovers than sugar-latte-people (lol me). Their pastry options are fun--I'd suggest the cupcakes and donuts most, though my friends love the muffins and scones too. 
GO HERE & BE HAPPY! YAY!

data.title: Horrible Lunch
data.text: Ordered Reuben and it came with some sort of roast beef, not corned. It was so tough it was impossible to eat.  For $11.50 these people should be ashamed to serve something like this and I told them as much.  Red flags should have been raised when I noticed I was the only one there eating lunch at 1130 am.

data.title: Great stop for a quick bite in a unique setting
data.text: We had a good latte here and a yummy plate of a panini with marinated broccoli. The surroundings are open, yet comfortable and cool. Definitely will be back.

data.title: They do everything right
data.text: I recommend biscuits and gravy off the breakfast menu, or the ruben, chicken panino, or Asian noodle bowl off the lunch menu. I have adored everything I tried. Coffee is awesome, too. I like to camp out at Urban all day and get mad homework done while filling up on delicious treats. They also serve an abundance of pastries if that's more your thing.

data.title: Caring staff, excellent food and coffee, I will return!
data.text: Yesterday I visited Urban Standard for lunch.  When I realized that I didn't have enough cash in my wallet to pay for my order, the staff volunteered to cover my remaining balance.  I work in customer service as a flight attendant and was reminded of the significance of kindness and generosity.  Thank you Caleb (and management) for serving me with compassion.  I will pay it forward.

data.title: great for breakfast
data.text: For my first breakfast in Birmingham, this placed rocked.  I had the red eye gravy and biscuits, and also tried my boyfriend's grits.  They were both awesome (particularly yummy was the bacon jam that came with the biscuits).  The bacon and cheese scone was really special too.  Additionally, coffee was superb.  The ambiance was hipstery, and they serve breakfast until 11am on Saturdays.

data.title: Wonderful place for coffee and breakfast!
data.text: I was in  Birmingham for a week and my only regret is that I found Urban Standard on my second morning rather than my first.  I worked my way through he menu (granola, eggs, scones, grits, biscuits) and each item was delicious.  The coffee was strong and well prepared.  And the staff was beyond outstanding.

data.title: Eclectic Spot Full of Energy
data.text:
A coffee date landed my friend and I at Urban Standard in downtown Birmingham. She's a regular and could order her "regular," but I, being a vagabond, could not. The decor was eclectic in a large open-brick format of two storefronts combined through a removed brick wall.

Maps lined those walls, as numerous other items. I loved the large table format in the center, even though she and I sat removed to chat. The coffee was good and they were willing to brew us a fresh pot to ensure we got our coffee at the same time. It was easy to chat, though I do wish the chairs were a bit more comfortable, or at least they offered more cushiony seating for those not looking to eat or work on stuff. I also wish our schedules could have permitted staying longer!

data.title: Amazing hot chocolate!
data.text: Cool vibe and great hot chocolate! They apparently make their own chocolate syrup and it is to die for!

data.title: Great environment
data.text: The place was great and very well decorated. The staff were friendly and answered my questions with ease.  My friend's latte was wonderful. I would return again when I am in town again, but I wouldn't get the iced coffee again.

data.title: Quaint place, food was excellent
data.text: Found this little, tucked away eating establishment.  Excellent food, service and staff was very friendly.  Great atmosphere.

data.title: Delicious coffee
data.text: Excellent coffee! Very cool, urban atmosphere. Baristas were very accommodating and helpful in choosing a brew. Super friendly!

data.title: Great Coffee
data.text: Great spot meet friends, grab a coffee to go, or to set up your office for the day. Nice & bright space with a modern design. Great coffee and tasty treats. My friend loved his eggs & grits. Next time.

data.title: Great morning spot
data.text: My husband and I came downtown with 2 other couples for Art Walk, but we were a little early, so stopped here to kill a little time.  We all wanted to try their Peach Cupcakes made with Chilton peaches...they were really good.  But if we wanted to get a full breakfast the next time we come here, they serve breakfast entrees as well as sandwiches.  Along with their goodies to eat, they also serve lattes and other types of coffees, etc.

data.title: Good Food, and Charming Vibe
data.text: Our group stumbled upon this unique charming lunch spot. The crowd was a mix of coffee house goers studying and reading, and small groups enjoying a nice lunch. The lunch menu is pretty straight forward. Options are salads and sandwiches, and yummy desserts. The wine donuts were amazing, sweet tasting but not overpowering. They were very moist, way more then a regular donut. The service was fast even though they were very busy and the staff was very friendly and attentive.

data.title: Best Red Velvet on Earth
data.text: Seriously the best red velvet cupcake I have ever had! The grilled cheese is also amazing. Cute small coffee shop great place to work, study, hang out or do business.
